name: Kings Inn Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here one night because it was right at the start of Spring Break and the hotels were filling up and we needed to get a room somewhere. Our room was on the freeway side and was really pretty noisy. Everything about the room was generally average. No fridge, no coffee maker... just a basic hotel room.
reviews.title: Nothing special
Great Little Place
reviews.text: The outdoor hot tub was good, the ice machine needs three hands to use properly, and WiFi works OK eventually. Breakfast at the Waffle Spot was OK but needed the 10% discount that comes with the room to bring the price into line with other places. I was asked for photo ID when I presented a credit card at the till, which was annoying since I had to go out to the car to get a passport. Nobody else needed photo ID for me to buy something and it certainly shouldn't be required for a $20 breakfast.

Also, what is with 'non-dairy creamer'? Haven't people in America heard of milk? Complimentary coffee from the lobby is fine if you have milk and sugar to go with it but powdered non-dairy creamer makes the whole exercise pointless.
reviews.title: Eh..Good for a couple of days

reviews.text: After reading some of the reviews I was afraid to stay there alone with my two kids. I was so happy to see how safe the hotel feels, we had a room by the pool, my kyds love the waffle spot, the room was basic, however it was clean. the front desk was great giving me directions to the zoo and sea world, it was great staying there, I'm sure we will return soon.
reviews.title: This place is a NIGHTMARE!
nice place for the price
reviews.text: This hotel was OK. Like other people said the bathrooms are tiny, my husband was too tall for the shower (he is 5'9) One of the ceiling panels fell off & hit me in the head. They could have cleaned a lot better, dirty doors, walls,etc.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for five nights in September and really enjoyed it.
reviews.title: Top Hotel

likes.liked: — The value for money and location
likes.disliked: — Starting to look a little old. Waffle spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is easy to find, just off highway 8 interstate 163. On hotel circle which is signposted on the highway.
reviews.title: Ok, just

reviews.text: The reception staff are very helpful. They were excellent when we checked in and gave us some discount vouchers for the Waffle Spot & Amigo. He also gave us a voucher for Macy's giving us 11% off for the five days we were there. We asked for directions a few times while there and each time they gave us a little card with exact directions from the hotel to the place. This was excellent and a really good touch.
reviews.title: Musty and Moldy!

reviews.text: The room. Pros: Basic but clean. Comfy bed. Thick curtains, quiet, good size, air con. Cons: TV reception wasn't the best. Air con a little noisy. The bathroom door didn't shut properly
reviews.title: A few disapointments

likes.liked: — It's location in relation to the places we were visiting
likes.disliked: — No coffee pots in room, check out staff was less than friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool was large and during the day was really quiet. It did get a little noisy in evening, and is open until 10 so you might want to ask for a room away from it.
reviews.title: Great 70's-style hotel

reviews.text: Great value, they now have free wi-fi in the rooms. Great service, they have little papers with instructions on how to get everywhere. Convenient to everything. Bathrooms are small, and this is no means a Hyatt, but we paid 50 bucks a night . Buy your Sea World and Zoo tickets here, you get two days for the price of one at Sea World and the Zoo ticket adds the sky tram and tour bus at no additional cost.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.text: I was looking for banquet facilities for my parents 50th anniversary and chose the Kings Inn. The staff is very friendly and the lady in charge of setting up the banquet was very kind. We booked multiple rooms and everything was clean and very inexpensive considering the area. Please understand that it is an older hotel. If you're looking to save money this is the place. The anniversary party was perfect. The banquet room, setup, etc. is FREE. All you pay for is the catering. They setup tables, placesettings, dance floor, even decorated, all for just the cost of the food which was good and also reasonably priced. They saved us a ton of money with the banquet. The room isn't too large (max about 50 people I think), but there is room for a dance floor, balcony and a small bar also. There are coupons at [--]
reviews.title: Clean, inexpensive, great location, friendly staff

reviews.text: Have stayed there several times. Live in SD and use it as a get away. One of few places with adjoining rooms. Family friendly most of the time. On first stay, adults were drinking in the hot tub. Other than that, rooms are nice and always very clean. Ice, soda and snack machine easy to get to. Nice desk to work at and table to sit at and eat. Room service was good, food arrived hot. Overall have enjoyed my stays here and we plan to stay there in the future when we want to get away from our house.
reviews.title: Good get away

reviews.text: the rooms were very nice and comfortable and the staff was very helpful and nice to us in every thing we needed. The food was great at both the restrunts and it is nice to have a little store so close to you while there.I will be reckamenting it to others. And if and when I return to the area I will most serently be staying ther agian.
reviews.title: Super

reviews.text: Where to begin with how bad this place was. The only nice thing I can say is I did not see any vermin on the property.
reviews.title: No king would ever stay here!

reviews.text: Arrived 6pm and had 3 rooms next to each other on 2nd floor away from highway as request when making booking. Small difference in price for rooms altered immediately upon request.
reviews.title: Very Helpfull Staff

reviews.text: Everywhere I wanted to go, eg shopping, restaurants, seaworld, zoo, Tijuana, the front desk staff had a printout with driving directions. Made getting around so easy.
reviews.title: Great value!

reviews.text: Rooms were average but clean and tidy, some with new matresses.
reviews.title: Loved it

reviews.text: Used the pool, hot tub, laundry, and comp coffee/tea.
reviews.title: perfect resting place

reviews.text: All clean & tidy.
reviews.title: Okay

description: Kings Inn has been serving excellence in San Diego for over fifty years. Located in Hotel Circle of Interstate 8, we are three miles from Seaworld and The San Diego Zoo and within fifteen minutes from nearly everything you will want to see and do while visiting America’s Finest City.Our Full Service Hotel features all newly updated nonsmoking rooms, two restaurants and a lounge, a sparkling pool and spa that are heated year round, and over 4,000 feet of meeting and banquet facilities. Guests can enjoy the added benefits of free parking, free local calls and free WiFi.Kings Inn is privately owned and operated and is committed to providing comfortable accommodations, exceptional service and optimal affordability to our valued guests.
